body_html:
I think the issue is that in def decode_image(), BMP, JPEG, and PNG images would have the shape of [height, width, num_channels], and GIF images would have the shape of [num_frames, height, width, 3].
So the rank of the shape could be 3 or 4, depending on the image type.

Unfortunately, finding out if it is GIF image will require checking the content of the input tensor which is not available until runtime.
body_text:
I think the issue is that in def decode_image(), BMP, JPEG, and PNG images would have the shape of [height, width, num_channels], and GIF images would have the shape of [num_frames, height, width, 3].
So the rank of the shape could be 3 or 4, depending on the image type.
Unfortunately, finding out if it is GIF image will require checking the content of the input tensor which is not available until runtime.
body:
I think the issue is that in `def decode_image()`, BMP, JPEG, and PNG images would have the shape of `[height, width, num_channels]`, and GIF images would have the shape of `[num_frames, height, width, 3]`.
So the rank of the shape could be 3 or 4, depending on the image type.

Unfortunately, finding out if it is GIF image will require checking the content of the input tensor which is not available until runtime.
